context/9: France on the west, Russia on the East,

context/1: So I drove them around until, all of a sudden, one of them says:
context/2: They wanted to go to a certain place in Beverly Hills, only they didn't know the address.
context/3: A couple of ladies I picked up on Sunset.
context/5: Well, Mr. Keddie, I notice that trip number 984 on your sheet is one which you have marked the destination to be Whittier and Wilshire.
context/6: I'm sorry, Your Honour, of course.
context/7: The court would like to look at those papers too, Mr. Prosecutor.
context/9: Now let me have the receipt.

context: Are you the only doctor in the neighbourhood?
context/0: He said one of his guests was ill.
context/1: The owner of the Vista Motel.
context/3: On Wednesday around noon.
context/4: Dr. Renault, when was the first time you were called in to treat Mr. Davenport?
context/5: You're still under oath.
context/6: You were sworn in yesterday, sir.
context/7: Dr. Renault to the stand, please.
context/8: If the court please, I'd like to continue my cross-examination of Dr. Renault.

context: Now, look here, you can't expect us to tell you every move we make, you know.
response: Then the criminal would know what we're doing, too, wouldn't he?
context/1: And you must confess, you haven't given me very much to turn in so far.
context/2: I just have to turn in a story each day.
context/3: No good to complain to me about it.
context/5: These things can't be done overnight, you know.
context/6: After all, we've only had four days.
